--- In gladiator@y..., "oldschool518" <johnnyoldschool@e...> wrote:
> barbarians should get a "drop boulder" move with alternate "boulder 
> mine". both would leave a boulder in the wake of the Barbarian (or 
> possibly in front of the barbarian). both would also severely impede 
> movement through until they were destroyed in the usual fashion. the 
> alternate would cost considerably more mana and would explode after 
> several seconds, sending rock shards in, say, 8 directions. these 
> would follow the usual rules and harm only enemies.

good idea.
 
> now, as for mages, i figure they need something to replace or 
> possibly someone to fix energy wave. i remember it as the most 
> pathetic attack that guzzled magic power and did pitiful damage. i 
> also read it was supposed to go through walls which it most 
certainly did not.

I certainly agree.

>if it were to be changed, i think a super-keen solution 
> would be to make it a kinetic energy wave, knocking aside 
> projectiles, doors, and enemies at the cost of slightly less mana 
> than the previous version. the kinetic nature of the wave would make 
> it feasible to stop at large impediments, such as walls, but allow 
> it to continue for a longer distance with less effect.

That sounds like a good alternate attack.

I have two big complaints against mages:

1)freeze time ability - Hypothetically, your entire team could be 
wiped out while frozen.  I do believe in a maximum amount of time 
being frozen and putting some limitations on huch damage can be 
inflicted while time is frozen.  Also, if you keep freezing time, you 
will end up restarting from strach with the amount of time frozen.  
Yep, I've done  that with one character.

2)damn vulnerability to faeries - That is ridiculous.  1 blow from a 
faerie can knock out a high experience level mage out of commission 
for over 30 minutes, even at maximum game speed.  The only relief is 
using heartburst attack or the warp space attack.  I'll talk about how 
to solve that problem when we get to faeries.

Other

1a)heartburst attack - I'd like some option to limit heartburst to 
attack only one character class.  That could really be advantageous if 
trying to get lots of experience points and you don't want to destroy 
the generator and/or opponent summoner.

1b)heartburst attack - With the same amount of energy used in a 
heartburst attack, I can do a lot more damage with their basic attack. 
 The only advantage in using heartburst is taking out faeries and/or 
weaker opponents.
